Title: Trump stirs global tensions with surprise nuclear test order
Summary: US President Donald Trump’s surprise directive to begin nuclear weapons testing provoked global criticism . The announcement came in the wake of Russia saying it had tested a nuclear-powered and nuclear-capable torpedo, as well as a torpedo .

Title: ASUU alleges mismanagement at Kano varsity, queries VC’s credibility
Summary: Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU), Aliko Dangote University of Science and Technology, Kano, has accused the university authority of mismanagement of resources . The union requested the audited reports and Budget Performance Reports of the University for the period .

Title: ECOWAS@50: Leaders, experts disagree on relevance of regional bodies
Summary: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) marks its 50th anniversary . Political leaders, scholars, and policymakers disagree over whether regional organisations remain essential to Africa’s integration or have become detached bureaucracies failing to serve the people . While ECOWAS@50: Leaders, experts disagree on relevance of regional bodies .

Title: Veteran broadcaster drums support for Oyebanji’s second term
Summary: Veteran broadcaster and media consultant, Mrs Ronke Kolawole, has rallied support for Governor Biodun Oyebanji of Ekiti State for a second term in office . Speaking with some journalists shortly after a private tour of the facility at Ilawe General .

Title: C’River Assembly clears lawmaker of N1.6b allegation
Summary: The Cross River State House of Assembly has cleared the member representing Yakurr I State Constituency, Hon. Cyril James Omini, of allegations that he collected N1.6 billion from a construction firm handling state road projects .

Title: Anambra Guber: Police intensify election security training for personnel
Summary: The Police Command in Anambra says it will sustain election security training for its officers and men, ahead of the Nov. 8 governorship poll in the State .

Title: Trump says US will conduct nuclear tests if other countries do
Summary: US President Donald Trump said Friday that the United States will conduct nuclear testing if other countries do so . Trump maintained ambiguity over what type of testing he is referring to .

Title: Redouble your efforts to fulfill promises you made to Nigerians, Nsukka Anglican Synod tells Tinubu
Summary: Anglican Diocese of Nsukka has called on President Bola Ahmed Tinubu to “redouble his efforts to fulfill the promises he made to Nigerians,” as it raised strong concerns over economic hardship and insecurity .

Title: 2027: Tinubu re-election unstoppable – BTO for PBAT support group
Summary: Bola Tinubu's support group BTO for PBAT declares his re-election is unstoppable . The support group has declared that his election is unstoppable ahead of the 2027 election .

Title: Court restrains INEC from monitoring, recognising PDP-planned national convention
Summary: Court restrains INEC from monitoring, recognising PDP-planned national convention . Besides, he held that the PDP failed to issue the mandatory 21-day notice of meetings and congresses .

Title: JUST IN: Premier League cuts traditional Boxing Day fixtures to one match
Summary: Boxing Day has been a cornerstone of English football culture for over a century, typically featuring a full round of Premier League fixtures, a festive highlight for fans, families, and television audiences worldwide . Title: New EFCC Ilorin boss vows tougher anti-graft fight
Summary: The newly appointed Ilorin Zonal Director of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, CE Anselem Ozioko, has pledged to intensify the Commission’s anti-graft efforts across Kwara, Kogi, and Niger States . He made the commitment on Friday, during a brief handover ceremony held at the Commission

Title: Hundreds dead in Tanzania post-election violence, says opposition
Summary: President Samia Suluhu Hassan had sought to cement her position and silence critics in her party with an emphatic win in Wednesday's election . But the vote descended into chaos as crowds took to the streets of Dar es Salaam and other cities, tearing down her posters and attacking police and polling stations . Title: Sudan's RSF claims arrests as UN warns of ‘horrendous’ atrocities
Summary: Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) said they had arrested several fighters accused of abuses during capture of El-Fasher . The RSF, which has been at war with the Sudanese army since April 2023, seized the city on October 26 after an 18-month siege . The UN said the death toll

Title: Ogun monarch urges cultural renaissance to foster peace, unity
Summary: The Akarigbo and paramount ruler of Remoland, Oba Babatunde Ajayi, has emphasised the need for Nigerians to embrace cultural renaissance as a tool for fostering peace, unity, and socio-economic development . He made the call on Friday during a press briefing at the Remo Growth and Development Foundation
